title: Diploma in Toyota Production System
headline: Learn about the key principles and practices of the Toyota Production System with this free online course.
description: This free online course explains the principles and practices used in the Toyota Production System. You will learn how several manufacturing approaches are effectively used in Toyota. This course will be great interest to operations managers, industrial engineers and professionals who need to know the best practices in operations. Start this course and learn how to ensure no waste and consistently high quality in production processes.
courseDescription:
This free online course explains why manufacturing is one of the most important activities for wealth generation, and there is an increasing interest in developing high-quality manufacturing activities. This course explores how Toyota consistently raises the bar in areas such as manufacturing, product development, and process excellence. The result is an amazing business success story with Toyota steadily taking market share from competitors, earning more profit than any other automaker, and winning the praise of business leaders worldwide.

The course begins by examining various aspects of Toyotaâ€™s approach to high-quality manufacturing activities, and also focuses on how  to achieve sustainability through excellence in operations. You will learn how Toyota consistently focuses on what is needed, when it is needed, at every stage of production. The course also discusses how Toyota always ensures that there is no waste and that there is consistently high quality in their production processes.

Next, you will learn how Toyota ensures that production lines are always stocked with all the right parts, in the right sequence as production begins. New stocks are always delivered at the right time and in the right quantity such that there is not interruption or slow down in the production process. You will learn how Toyota uses a Kanban system which is central to their just-in-time process, providing an automatic and real time method to replenishing parts with focus on higher quality and lower cost. Start this course today and learn about the key principles and practices of the Toyota Production System.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital : a downloadable in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • : a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked , posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed : a physical version of your officially branded and security marked in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

All are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison , please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison , you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

• Learning Outcomes 
  • Upon successfully completion of  this module, you should be able to:
    • Explain the meaning of manufacturing
    • Define manufacturing as a value addition process
    • Define a systems approach to operations management 
    • Explain the causes of wealth creation 
    • Discuss agriculture, manufacturing and service as a source of wealth creation
    • Explain deflation factor costs, decline in China and new manufacturing locations
    • Analyze how decreasing cost of input resources and same level of output resources result in additional margin for manufacturers

  • Lesson Summary
  • Having completed this module, you should be able to:
    • Outline the success of the Toyota manufacturing company
    • Define the Toyota idea and its relationship with the 4Ps
    • Discuss the elimination of waste in the Toyota production system
    • Explain how Toyota was able to improve quality of product without increasing the cost of the product 
    • Discuss the processing part as the key to the Toyota production system
    • Identify value added activities and non value added activities in the Toyota production system
    • Discuss the linear system process in Toyota production system 
    • Explain the concept of material management as a very important aspect of competitiveness 
    • Explain the inventory management of finished goods 
  • Learning Outcomes
  • Upon successful completion of this module, you should be able to: 
    • Explain the 4 Ps of the Toyota production system, including philosophy, process, people and problems 
    • Discuss the Toyota way is more than tools and techniques
    • Define the Toyota production system as a system that provides the tools for people to continually improve their work
    • Analyze the right processes used for getting the right  results 
    • Explain how to add value to the organization by developing your people and partners 
    • Discuss Toyota as one of the most conservative company from any aspect 
    • Explain the Toyota - Lexus story 
    • Describe the philosophical sense of purpose that supersedes any short term decision making
    • Explain the philosophical mission as the foundation for all the other principles 
    • Discuss the application of continuous flow in lean manufacturing

  • Lesson Summary
  • Having completed this module, you should be able to:
    • Discuss how to add value to an organization by developing people and partner 
    • Define all the 4Ps of the Toyota production system
    • Explain how to solve root problems which will help organizational learning 
    • Analyze all the 4Ps of the Toyota production system 
    • Discuss the Japanese versions of the 4Ps model
    • Explain the reason for respect for partners in the supply chain 
    • Discuss how to continuously solve root problems that drive organisational learning 
    • Explain why we should have a philosophical sense of purpose 
    • Examine the sense of purpose of people working in Toyota 
    • Differentiate between employees who work in Indian companies and employees who work in Toyota 
  • Learning Outcomes 
  • Upon successful completion of this module, you should be able to:
    • Explain overproduction as one of the biggest tenets of the Toyota production system 
    • Explain the pull system as a lean manufacturing strategy used to reduce waste in the manufacturing process
    • List some examples of the pull system from everyday life
    • Analyze the pull system and the levelling workload as two extremes of the Toyota production process
    • Define MUDA as wasteful activities that lengthen lead time 
    • Define MURI as pushing a person or machine beyond natural limits 
    • Discuss Jidoka as the second pillar of TPS
    • Explain the methods used to detect defects when they occur 
    • Explain how standardization  of tasks became a science when mass production replaced the craft form of production

  • Lesson Summary
  • Having completed this module, you should be able to:
    • Explain the pull system as a very important part of lean manufacturing strategy 
    • Define the concept of real demand in the lean manufacturing system 
    • Examine the relationship between demands from customers and immediate profits and returns 
    • Discuss visual signals and its implementation in manufacturing and servicing organizations 
    • Define levelling the workload system 
    • Discuss why organizations produce in large quantities and fix defective problems later 
    • Discuss FW Taylor's scientific concept 
    • Discuss the fundamentals and standardization in a production system
    • Explain overproduction as a waste that give rise to other problems 
    • Explain how the Toyota production system can transform you to become a world class organization 
  • Learning Outcomes 
  • Upon successful completion of this module, you should be able to:
    • List out the reliable, thoroughly tested technology that can be used by the people in the system 
    • Explain Toyota as a global benchmark on how to use value added technology
    • Determine how Toyota values people over technology 
    • Explain how Toyota grow leaders who think thoroughly, understand the work, live the philosophy and it to others 
    • List out the benefits growing leaders rather than purchasing them 
    • List out the benefits of developing an exceptional team
    • Explain the idea behind Toyota expecting its leaders to teach their surbodinates the Toyota way
    • Explain how Toyota expect its leaders to support the organization culture year after year
    • Explain how Toyota develops excellent individual work while promoting team work
    • Define the classical motivation stories and the Toyota way
